metadata.title: Jesus Prayer
metadata.description: Eastern Christian prayer of the heart, repeated for inner stillness and repentance
metadata.origin: Ancient Eastern Christian tradition, popularized by the Desert Fathers and Hesychast monks
metadata.usage: Repeated continuously as a mantra for contemplative prayer and spiritual discipline

la.text: Domine Iesu Christe, Fili Dei, miserere mei peccatoris.
la.notes: Latin version of the Jesus Prayer used in Eastern Catholic traditions

en.text: Lord Jesus Christ, Son of God, have mercy on me, a sinner.
en.notes: Standard English translation of the Jesus Prayer

es.text: Señor Jesucristo, Hijo de Dios, ten piedad de mí, pecador.
es.notes: Spanish translation of the Jesus Prayer

fr.text: Seigneur Jésus-Christ, Fils de Dieu, aie pitié de moi, pécheur.
fr.notes: French translation of the Jesus Prayer

de.text: Herr Jesus Christus, Sohn Gottes, erbarme dich meiner, eines Sünders.
de.notes: German translation of the Jesus Prayer

it.text: Signore Gesù Cristo, Figlio di Dio, abbi pietà di me peccatore.
it.notes: Italian translation of the Jesus Prayer

pt.text: Senhor Jesus Cristo, Filho de Deus, tende piedade de mim, pecador.
pt.notes: Portuguese translation of the Jesus Prayer

pl.text: Panie Jezu Chryste, Synu Boży, zmiłuj się nade mną grzesznikiem.
pl.notes: Polish translation of the Jesus Prayer
